intro: Clinogyne comorensis, commonly known as the Comoros clinogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, with four petals. Clinogyne comorensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
